name: SEAI Attic Insulation Grant
short_description: Grant towards the cost of attic insulation to improve your home's energy efficiency and reduce heating bills.
long_description: The SEAI Individual Energy Upgrade Grant covers attic insulation for homes built before 2021. Proper attic insulation can reduce heat loss by up to 25% and significantly lower your heating costs. The grant covers apartment and house attic/ceiling insulation.

steps.title: Automatic if on Carer's payments
steps.description: If you already receive Carer's Allowance/Benefit, the grant is paid automatically.

steps.title: Apply if not receiving payments
steps.description: Otherwise, apply using form CSG 1.

name: Disability Allowance
short_description: Weekly payment for people aged 16-66 with a disability expected to last at least one year.
long_description: Disability Allowance is a means-tested weekly payment for people aged 16-66 with a disability that is expected to last at least one year and substantially restricts their ability to work.

eligibility_rules.description: You must have a disability expected to last at least 1 year
You must be aged between 16 and 66

steps.title: Get medical evidence
steps.description: Have your GP complete the medical report section of the application form.

steps.title: Apply
steps.description: Complete the Disability Allowance form and submit with medical evidence.

documents.description: Completed by your GP on the application form
Public Services Card or other ID

name: Cycle to Work Scheme
short_description: Save up to €1,250 in tax on a new bicycle and safety equipment (up to €3,500 for e-bikes).
long_description: The Cycle to Work scheme allows employees to buy a bicycle and safety equipment tax-free through their employer. The benefit can be availed of once every 4 years. Limit is €1,250 for standard bikes or €3,500 for electric bikes.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be a PAYE employee

steps.title: Check with employer
steps.description: Ask your employer if they participate in the Cycle to Work scheme.

steps.title: Choose a bike
steps.description: Select a bike and safety equipment from a participating retailer.

steps.title: Employer purchases
steps.description: Your employer purchases the bike and deducts the cost from your salary (before tax) over 12 months.

name: Maternity Benefit
short_description: Payment of €274 per week for 26 weeks while on maternity leave from work.
long_description: Maternity Benefit is a payment made to women who are on maternity leave from work and covered by social insurance (PRSI). It is paid for 26 weeks.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be in employment or self-employment

steps.title: Notify your employer
steps.description: Give your employer at least 4 weeks' notice of your maternity leave.

steps.title: Apply online
steps.description: Apply at least 6 weeks before your maternity leave starts.

documents.description: Employer's name, address, and PRSI details

name: Medical Expenses Tax Relief
short_description: Claim 20% tax relief on qualifying medical expenses not covered by insurance.
long_description: You can claim tax relief at 20% on qualifying medical expenses that you have paid and are not reimbursed by insurance. This includes GP visits, prescribed medicines, hospital charges, physiotherapy, and more.

eligibility_rules.description: You must have qualifying medical expenses

steps.title: Keep receipts
steps.description: Keep all receipts for medical expenses throughout the year.

steps.title: Claim at year end
steps.description: Claim through Revenue myAccount or ROS in your annual tax return.

documents.description: Receipts for all medical expenses claimed

name: Tuition Fees Tax Relief
short_description: Tax relief at 20% on qualifying tuition fees for approved undergraduate and postgraduate courses.
long_description: You can claim tax relief at 20% on tuition fees paid for approved courses in approved colleges. The maximum relief is on fees up to €7,000 per course per academic year. The first €3,000 for full-time (€1,500 for part-time) is disregarded.
amount_description: 20% tax relief on fees up to €7,000

eligibility_rules.description: You are a student in approved education
You are planning to enter education

steps.title: Ensure course is approved
steps.description: Check that the college and course are on Revenue's approved list.

steps.title: Claim at year end
steps.description: Claim through Revenue myAccount or ROS.

documents.description: Receipt from college showing fees paid

name: Household Benefits Package
short_description: Free electricity/gas allowance and free TV licence for qualifying households.
long_description: The Household Benefits Package includes a monthly electricity or gas allowance and a free TV licence. Available to people aged 70+ and some people under 70 receiving qualifying welfare payments.
amount_description: Monthly electricity/gas allowance + free TV licence

eligibility_rules.description: You are aged 70 or over
You are aged 66-69 and living alone or with qualifying person
You are on Disability Allowance and living alone

steps.title: Check eligibility
steps.description: You must be 70+ or receiving a qualifying payment and meet other conditions.

steps.title: Apply
steps.description: Apply online at MyWelfare.ie or at your local DSP office.

name: Back to School Clothing and Footwear Allowance
short_description: Annual payment to help with the cost of school uniforms and footwear — €160 per child (4-11) or €285 per child (12+).
long_description: The Back to School Clothing and Footwear Allowance (BSCFA) helps families on low incomes with the cost of school uniforms and footwear at the start of the school year.

eligibility_rules.description: You must have children of school-going age
Your household income must be below the BSCFA limit

steps.title: Check if automatic
steps.description: Many families on qualifying payments receive BSCFA automatically.

steps.title: Apply if needed
steps.description: Apply through MyWelfare.ie during the application window (June-September).

name: Landlord Retrofit Tax Deduction
short_description: Tax deduction of up to €10,000 per property for landlords who carry out energy upgrades.
long_description: Landlords who carry out energy efficiency upgrades on rental properties can claim a tax deduction of up to €10,000 per property against rental income. Works must achieve a BER improvement of at least one grade.
amount_description: Up to €10,000 tax deduction per property

eligibility_rules.description: You must be a landlord with rental properties

steps.title: Carry out energy upgrades
steps.description: Complete qualifying energy upgrades that improve the BER by at least one grade.

steps.title: Keep documentation
steps.description: Keep BER certificates (before and after) and all invoices.

steps.title: Claim on tax return
steps.description: Claim the deduction when filing your annual tax return.

documents.description: Before and after BER assessments showing improvement

name: ACRES — Agri-Climate Rural Environment Scheme
short_description: Annual payment of €7,000-€10,000+ for farmers implementing environmental and climate actions.
long_description: ACRES is the agri-environment scheme under Ireland's CAP Strategic Plan. It pays farmers to carry out environmental actions on their land. There are two tiers: General (€7,000+/year) and Co-operation Project (€10,000+/year).

eligibility_rules.description: You must be an active farmer

steps.title: Contact an agricultural advisor
steps.description: An approved ACRES advisor will help you apply and create your plan.

steps.title: Submit application
steps.description: Your advisor submits the application on your behalf during the application window.

documents.description: Your Department of Agriculture herd number
Details of land and farming activities

name: Enterprise Ireland Innovation Voucher
short_description: €5,000 voucher to work with a research institution on an innovation project for your business.
long_description: The Innovation Voucher is worth €5,000 and allows a small business to work with a publicly funded research body to explore a business opportunity or solve a technical problem.

eligibility_rules.description: You must own a business registered in Ireland
Business must have fewer than 50 employees

steps.title: Identify a research partner
steps.description: Find a research institution to work with on your innovation project.

steps.title: Apply online
steps.description: Apply through the Enterprise Ireland website.

documents.description: Brief description of the innovation project

name: Jobseeker's Allowance
short_description: Means-tested weekly payment if you are unemployed and looking for work.
long_description: Jobseeker's Allowance is a means-tested social welfare payment for people who are unemployed and looking for full-time work. You must be aged 18-66, available for and genuinely seeking work.
amount_description: Up to €220/week (varies by age and circumstances)

eligibility_rules.description: You must be unemployed and looking for work
You must be aged between 18 and 66

steps.title: Sign on
steps.description: Visit your local Intreo centre to register as unemployed.

steps.title: Provide documentation
steps.description: Bring ID, proof of address, and evidence of means/income.

documents.description: Passport, driving licence, or Public Services Card
From your last employer if recently unemployed

name: State Pension (Contributory)
short_description: Weekly pension of up to €277.30 for people aged 66+ with enough PRSI contributions.
long_description: The State Pension (Contributory) is paid to people aged 66+ who have enough Class A or S PRSI contributions. The amount depends on your contribution record.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be aged 66 or over

steps.title: Check your PRSI record
steps.description: Request a copy of your PRSI contribution record from the DSP.

steps.title: Apply 3 months before turning 66
steps.description: Submit your application at least 3 months before your 66th birthday.

name: One Parent Family Payment
short_description: Weekly payment for people parenting alone who are not cohabiting and have a qualifying child.
long_description: The One-Parent Family Payment is a means-tested weekly payment for people aged under 66 who are bringing up a child without the support of a partner. The payment continues until the youngest child is 7.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be parenting alone
You must have at least one qualifying child

steps.title: Apply
steps.description: Complete the OFP 1 application form and submit to your local DSP office.

name: LEO Trading Online Voucher
short_description: Up to €2,500 to help your business develop an online trading presence.
long_description: The Trading Online Voucher helps small businesses with up to 10 employees to develop their online trading capability. It covers 50% of eligible costs for website development, e-commerce, and online marketing.

eligibility_rules.description: You must own a business
Business must have 10 or fewer employees

steps.title: Attend a seminar
steps.description: Attend a free Trading Online information seminar.

steps.title: Apply online
steps.description: Submit your application through the LEO website.

documents.description: Quote from web developer or digital agency

name: Dependent Relative Tax Credit
short_description: Tax credit of €305 per year for each qualifying dependent relative you support financially.
long_description: The Dependent Relative Tax Credit is worth €305 per qualifying relative per year. You can claim it if you maintain a relative at your own expense, including a widowed parent, a parent aged 65 or over, or a relative incapacitated by old age or infirmity. The relative's income must be below €18,028 per year. You can backdate claims for up to 4 years.

eligibility_rules.description: You must financially support a dependent relative (parent aged 65+, widowed parent, or incapacitated relative)

steps.title: Check eligibility
steps.description: Confirm your dependent relative's income is below €18,028 per year and you maintain them at your own expense.

steps.title: Gather documentation
steps.description: Collect proof of financial support and your relative's income details.

steps.title: Claim via myAccount
steps.description: Log in to Revenue myAccount, go to 'Manage Your Tax' and claim the Dependent Relative Tax Credit.

documents.description: Bank transfers, receipts, or other evidence of maintaining the relative
Evidence that the relative's income is below €18,028

name: Age Tax Credit
short_description: Tax credit of €245 (individual) or €490 (married couple) if you or your spouse are 65 or over.
long_description: The Age Tax Credit is available to anyone aged 65 or over. It provides a direct reduction in your income tax bill of €245 for a single person or €490 for a married couple where either spouse is 65+. This credit is in addition to your personal tax credit and is automatically applied once Revenue is aware of your age.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be aged 65 or over

steps.title: Check your tax credits
steps.description: Log in to Revenue myAccount and check if the Age Tax Credit is already applied to your record.

steps.title: Claim if not applied
steps.description: If not automatically applied, contact Revenue or update your tax credits via myAccount.

name: Blind Person's Tax Credit
short_description: Tax credit of €1,950 if you are blind or visually impaired, or €3,900 for a married couple where both are blind.
long_description: The Blind Person's Tax Credit provides a significant tax reduction for people who are blind or have a severe visual impairment. The credit is €1,950 for one person or €3,900 where both spouses are blind. You need a certificate from an ophthalmologist to claim this credit. A guide dog allowance of €825 is also available in addition to this credit.

eligibility_rules.description: You or your spouse must be blind or have a severe visual impairment

steps.title: Get medical certificate
steps.description: Obtain a certificate from your ophthalmologist confirming blindness or severe visual impairment.

steps.title: Submit to Revenue
steps.description: Send the certificate to Revenue or upload via myAccount to claim the credit.

documents.description: Medical certificate confirming blindness or severe visual impairment

name: Widowed Person or Surviving Civil Partner Tax Credit
short_description: Tax credit of €2,540 for widowed persons or surviving civil partners without dependent children.
long_description: If you are widowed or a surviving civil partner and do not have dependent children, you are entitled to the Widowed Person or Surviving Civil Partner Tax Credit of €2,540 per year. This replaces the married person's tax credit and is applied from the year following the year of bereavement. You must not be cohabiting or in a new civil partnership.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be widowed or a surviving civil partner
This credit is for widowed persons without dependent children

steps.title: Notify Revenue
steps.description: Inform Revenue of your bereavement by updating your personal details on myAccount.

steps.title: Credit applied
steps.description: The Widowed Person Tax Credit will be applied to your tax record automatically.

documents.description: Death certificate of your spouse or civil partner

name: Widowed Parent Tax Credit
short_description: Additional tax credit of up to €3,600 for widowed parents with dependent children, lasting 5 years after bereavement.
long_description: The Widowed Parent Tax Credit is available for 5 years following the year of bereavement. It is in addition to the Widowed Person Tax Credit and decreases each year: Year 1: €3,600, Year 2: €3,150, Year 3: €2,700, Year 4: €2,250, Year 5: €1,800. You must have at least one dependent child living with you and must not have remarried or be cohabiting.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be widowed or a surviving civil partner
You must have dependent children living with you

steps.title: Notify Revenue
steps.description: Update your personal details on Revenue myAccount to reflect your bereavement.

steps.title: Claim the credit
steps.description: The credit is applied automatically for 5 years if you have qualifying dependent children.

documents.description: Death certificate of your spouse or civil partner
Child Benefit records or children's birth certificates

name: Incapacitated Child Tax Credit
short_description: Tax credit of €3,800 per year for each child who is permanently incapacitated.
long_description: The Incapacitated Child Tax Credit of €3,800 per year is available to parents of children who are permanently incapacitated, either physically or mentally, and who became so before age 21 or while in full-time education. The child must be unable to maintain themselves. You can claim for multiple incapacitated children, and the credit can be backdated for up to 4 years.

eligibility_rules.description: You must have a child who is permanently incapacitated physically or mentally

steps.title: Get medical certification
steps.description: Have your child's doctor complete the Incapacitated Child Tax Credit claim form (IC1).

steps.title: Submit claim
steps.description: Submit the completed IC1 form to Revenue via myAccount or by post.

documents.description: Completed by a medical practitioner confirming permanent incapacity
To confirm your relationship to the child

name: Personal Tax Credit
short_description: Universal tax credit of €2,000 for every individual taxpayer, or €4,000 for married/civil partner couples.
long_description: The Personal Tax Credit is the most basic tax credit in Ireland, available to every taxpayer. It provides €2,000 per year for single, widowed, or separated persons, and €4,000 for married couples or civil partners who are jointly assessed. This credit is automatically applied to your tax record and directly reduces the amount of income tax you owe.

steps.title: Automatic
steps.description: This credit is automatically applied to all taxpayers. Check your Tax Credit Certificate on Revenue myAccount to confirm.

name: Employee (PAYE) Tax Credit
short_description: Tax credit of €2,000 for all PAYE employees, automatically applied by Revenue.
long_description: The Employee Tax Credit (also known as the PAYE Tax Credit) is worth €2,000 per year and is available to all individuals who pay tax through the PAYE system. Combined with the Personal Tax Credit, this means a typical employee saves €4,000 in tax annually. It is automatically applied to your tax record by Revenue.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be a PAYE employee

steps.title: Automatic
steps.description: This credit is automatically applied if you are employed. Check your Tax Credit Certificate to confirm.

name: Earned Income Tax Credit
short_description: Tax credit of €2,000 for self-employed individuals and proprietary directors.
long_description: The Earned Income Tax Credit is worth €2,000 per year and is the self-employed equivalent of the PAYE Tax Credit. It is available to sole traders, partners in partnerships, and proprietary directors who do not qualify for the PAYE Tax Credit. If you have both PAYE and self-employed income, the combined value of PAYE and Earned Income credits cannot exceed €2,000.

eligibility_rules.description: You must be self-employed or a proprietary director

steps.title: File your return
steps.description: Claim the Earned Income Credit when filing your annual income tax return (Form 11).

name: Mortgage Interest Tax Credit
short_description: Tax credit for homeowners whose mortgage interest increased since 2022 — available 2023-2026.
long_description: The Mortgage Interest Tax Credit was introduced in Budget 2024 to help homeowners struggling with rising interest rates. It applies to qualifying mortgage holders whose interest payments increased compared to 2022. The credit is 20% of the increase in interest paid, up to a maximum of €1,250 per property. Your outstanding mortgage balance must have been between €80,000 and €500,000 on 31 December 2022, and the property must be your principal private residence.

eligibility_rules.description: You must have a mortgage on your principal private residence
You must be a homeowner

steps.title: Check your mortgage balance
steps.description: Confirm your outstanding mortgage balance was between €80,000 and €500,000 on 31 December 2022.

steps.title: Get interest statements
steps.description: Obtain mortgage interest statements for 2022 and the claim year from your lender.

steps.title: Claim via Revenue
steps.description: File a claim through Revenue myAccount or ROS with your mortgage interest details.

documents.description: Annual mortgage interest statement from your lender
Statement showing your outstanding balance on 31 December 2022

name: Nursing Home Expenses Tax Relief
short_description: Income tax relief at your highest rate (up to 40%) on nursing home fees for you or a dependent.
long_description: You can claim Income Tax relief on nursing home fees paid for yourself, a spouse, a relative, or a dependent. The relief is given at your highest rate of tax (20% or 40%), making it one of the most valuable tax reliefs available. The nursing home must provide 24-hour on-site nursing care. This includes fees paid for a parent or dependent relative in a nursing home.
amount_description: Tax relief at your highest rate (20% or 40%)

eligibility_rules.description: You must be paying nursing home fees for yourself or a dependent

steps.title: Gather receipts
steps.description: Collect all receipts and statements from the nursing home showing fees paid.

steps.title: Claim via myAccount
steps.description: File your claim through Revenue myAccount under Health Expenses. Select 'Nursing Home' as the expense type.

documents.description: Receipts or statements showing nursing home fees paid
Confirmation that the nursing home provides 24-hour nursing care
